etymology.description: ideogrammic compound: 甡 ("broom") + 又 ("hand") — to hold a broom made of bamboo.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a hand grasping a broom, evoking the act of sweeping. By visual analogy, the long tail of a comet resembles a broom, leading to the astronomical meaning.

examples.chinese: 夜空中出现了一颗明亮的彗星(夜空中出現了一顆明亮的彗星)。
examples.pinyin: Yèkōng zhōng chūxiàn le yī kē míngliàng de huìxīng.
examples.english: A bright comet appeared in the night sky.

examples.chinese: 古人以彗为凶兆(古人以彗為凶兆)。
examples.english: The ancients regarded comets as bad omens.

examples.chinese: 天文学家正在研究这颗长尾彗星(天文學家正在研究這顆長尾彗星)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānwénxuéjiā zhèngzài yánjiū zhè kē chángwěi huìxīng.
examples.english: Astronomers are studying this long-tailed comet.
